page.title: 19COLTON, STAFFORDSHIRE
page.content: Colton is a small village on the north side of the Trent Valley in rural Staffordshire. About 500 people live in Colton. The village is built along three main streets, two going up the sides of the valley and the third going towards Rugeley across the Trent. There are no housing estates in Colton but the newer houses are built in groups along four new streets. At the centre of Colton where the main streets meet is the village shop. This is a general store with a sub-post office and sells all the essentials. There are two public houses in Colton, the Dun Cow at the top of the village and the Greyhound at the bottom. The Greyhound was closed in 1985 for extensive repairs and refitting. The village hall is used for all village events and is used as a youth club on Tuesday evenings.
